facilitySites.name: Georgia-Pacific Wood Products LLC (Sterling)
facilitySites.description: Sawmill with two Lumber Drying Kilns.

emissionsUnits.description: Various drop points around the facility (fugitive PM emissions).  Bark Truck LoadingAsh Loadin
emissionsUnits.comments: Includes the following misc drop points of fugitive PM emissionsBark Truck LoadingAsh LoadingSawdust Transfer and Truck LoadingChips Transfer and Truck LoadingShavings Pile
The unit breaks down the shavings with a hammer action.
The unit removes bark from the logs.
According to the renewed Title V permit (PERMIT NO. 2421-127-0027-V-04-0; ISSUANCE DATE: 05/18/17 ), the Sawmill is now EU ID 100
Unit hogs the trim blocks from the planar mill, then it mechanically conveys the material to a bin and truck load zone.

releasePoints.description: Includes the following misc drop points of fugitive PM emissionsBark Truck LoadingAsh Loading

emissionsProcesses.comments: Pressure treatment in a vacuum cylinder with a solution of Amine Copper Quaternary

emissionsProcesses.description: Includes the following misc drop points of fugitive PM emissionsBark Truck LoadingAsh LoadingSawdust Transfer and Truck LoadingChips Transfer and Truck LoadingShavings Pile
emissionsProcesses.comments: This is a combination of various material handling processes at the Mill.  Chip transfer emissions make up the majority of PM emissions for this group.  Therefore, selected SCC 30700821.  Includes the following misc drop points of fugitive PM emissionsBark Truck LoadingAsh LoadingSawdust Transfer and Truck LoadingChips Transfer and Truck LoadingShavings Pile

emissionsProcesses.sccDescription: Hardwood Sawmill Operations: Other Not Classified
Hardwood Sawmill Operations: Other Not Classified

emissionsProcesses.comments: Paved roads throughout the plant. Fugitive PM emissions potentially occur.

reportingPeriods.comments: Actual hours = zero for 2018 and actual throughput is also zero for 2018.
Fuel use calculated from non-resettable hour meter and maximum fuel consumption rate of 9.7 gal/hr
Individual ThroughputsBark Truck Loading = 22,407 TPYAsh Loading = 234 tpySawdust Transfer and Truck Loading = 12,091 TPYChips Transfer and Truck Loading = 130,820 tpyShavings Pile = 25,186 tpy

Hours provided represent annual average operation per kiln.  The two kilns combined operated for 11,778 hours.  Emissions include emissions from the two 1 MMBtu/hr propane burners.  Total Propane used for CY2018 = 1055 gallons.

emissions.comments: Chose "Engineering Judgment" because the units of grains per dry standard cubic feet are not available in the selection.  PM2.5 EF = 0.004 gr/dscf and the flow is 32,000 dscfm.  Annual hours of operation of planer mill = 4030.

Chose "Engineering Judgment" because the units of grains per dry standard cubic feet are not available in the selection.  PM10 EF = 0.009 gr/dscf and the flow is 32,000 dscfm.  Annual hours of operation of planer mill = 4030.
There was no treated lumber production for CY2018.  Therefore, the VOC emissions from this process are zero.
Chose "Engineering Judgment" because this includes emissions from the Trim Hog drop points and the trim hog cyclone.
Chose "Engineering Judgment" because this includes emissions from the Trim Hog drop points and the trim hog cyclone.

Chose Engineering Judgement in GECO as the Emission Calculation Method since the emission factors for the processes are different. Includes emissions from EU101, 103, 104 and 106, i.e., from the following units: Big Chipper, Tipple Slab Chipper, Edge Saw

Chose Engineering Judgment for emission calculation method since we are presenting emissions from propane combustion as well and the drying/shavings combustion factors are different from propane combustion.
